turns.content: I want you to act as a YouTube video scriptwriter. I want you to write a 10 minute long script for a YouTube video on the topic "what are top 10 most nutritious fruits in the world and their health benefits". I want you to keep your tone humorous and informative. Add an interesting hook in the intro and give detailed information about each fruit, their availability and their market price and unique facts about each fruit.

Sure thing! Here's a script for a 10-minute YouTube video on the topic of the top 10 most nutritious fruits in the world and their health benefits. Remember, this is just a sample and you should always consult with a medical professional before making any changes to your diet.

Intro:

"Hey there, fruit lovers! Are you tired of eating the same old apples and bananas every day? Well, you're in luck because today we're counting down the top 10 most nutritious fruits in the world, and trust us, you're going to want to add these to your grocery list ASAP. But before we get started, let's set the scene. Imagine yourself on a tropical island, surrounded by lush green trees, and the sweet aroma of fresh fruit filling the air. You take a bite of the juiciest, most flavorful fruit you've ever had, and suddenly, you're in fruit heaven. Well, that's what you're in for with this list, so grab a pen and paper, and let's get started!"

1. Acai berries:

"Coming in at number 10, we have acai berries. These tiny little berries pack a big punch when it comes to nutrition. They're loaded with antioxidants, fiber, and heart-healthy fats. Acai berries can be found in frozen berry packs, supplements, and even energy drinks. They're a bit on the pricey side, but trust us, they're worth it. Plus, they're native to Central and South America, so you can feel like a true exotic fruit connoisseur. And did you know that acai berries are also known for their anti-aging properties? So, not only will they taste delicious, but they'll also keep you looking young and vibrant.

2. Mangosteen:

"Coming in at number 9, we have the mangosteen. This tropical fruit is a favorite among health enthusiasts, and for good reason. It's rich in vitamins and minerals, and has anti-inflammatory properties. Mangosteen is a bit harder to find than some of the other fruits on our list, but it's definitely worth the search. It tastes a bit like a combination of peach, strawberry and pineapple. Some people even call it the queen of fruits. And did you know that the rind of the mangosteen fruit is used in traditional medicine in Southeast Asia?

3. Papaya:

"At number 8, we have papaya. This tropical fruit is not only delicious, but it's also packed with nutrients. It's high in vitamin C, vitamin A, and potassium. Papaya is also a great source of fiber, which can help with digestion. You can find papaya in most supermarkets, and it's relatively affordable. And did you know that papaya is also a natural anti-inflammatory? It's great for soothing sore muscles and joints.

4. Pomegranate:

"Coming in at number 7, we have the pomegranate. This fruit is a superfood, and for good reason. It's packed with antioxidants, vitamins, and minerals. Pomegranates are a bit more expensive than some of the other fruits on our list, but trust us, they're worth it. Not only are they delicious, but they're also great for your heart health. And did you know that pomegranates have been used in traditional medicine for thousands of years? They're known for their anti-inflammatory properties, and they're even said to have anti-cancer properties.

5. Kiwi:

"At number 6, we have the kiwi. This little fruit packs a big nutritional punch. It's high in vitamin C

Web search results:

[1] "Please continue. and various others. Please finish the sentence, however, feels a bit peremptory. Its an imperative that instructs the person to finish what they are saying and then stop to listen. Again, depending on the power dynamic, this may be appropriate if the person interrupting has something important to say. For example:"
Source: https://ell.stackexchange.com/questions/208652/please-continue-or-please-complete-your-sentence

[2] "1 : to maintain without interruption a condition, course, or action The boat continued downstream. 2 : to remain in existence : endure The tradition continues to this day. 3 : to remain in a place or condition : stay We cannot continue here much longer. 4 : to resume an activity after interruption Well continue after lunch. transitive verb 1 a"
Source: https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/continue

[3] "please continue is the most popular phrase on the web. More popular! please continue 12,800,000 results on the web Some examples from the web: Im sorry, please continue. But if it makes you happy please continue with your story Please continue to point out the obvious to me as it comes up."
Source: https://textranch.com/221403/please-proceed/or/please-continue/

Instructions: Using the provided web search results, write a comprehensive reply to the given prompt. Make sure to cite results using [[number](URL)] notation after the reference. If the provided search results refer to multiple subjects with the same name, write separate answers for each subject.
Prompt: please continue

"Please continue" is a phrase that is used to request that the person speaking or performing an action should continue with what they are doing without interruption. According to the web search results provided, it is an imperative that instructs the person to finish what they are saying and then stop to listen [[1](https://ell.stackexchange.com/questions/208652/please-continue-or-please-complete-your-sentence)]. The phrase can be used in various contexts such as in conversation, in writing, or

[1] "This fruit worksheet is geared towards helping kids learn to recognize, spell and write the names of some of the basic fruits including a lemon, orange, apple, pear and grapes. Kids are asked to look at each of the fruit pictures and then trace the name on the line provided. This will mainly help with practicing handwriting skills and is a ..."
Source: https://www.allkidsnetwork.com/worksheets/food/fruit/fruit-writing-worksheet.asp

[2] "Orange and yellow fruits. These fruits contain an antioxidant (beta carotene) that protects the eye from diseases and protects the body from cancer. Examples of these fruits include: orange, lemon, melon, apricot, yellow apple, cornflakes, mangoes and bananas."
Source: https://topicsinenglish.com/essay-on-fruits/

[3] "by. Nitin Sharma. $4.00. PDF. 80 Fruits And Vegetables Mini Books, Picture Writing, Back to School Week Activity, 80 Mini Books with Pictures and writing space, 8 Paged Mini Books, to develop cutting skills, coloring and use of pictures as prompts for writing activities."
